item.title: Louisiana police chiefs charged in immigrant visa fraud scheme
item.description: Three current and former police chiefs, a marshal and a business owner were charged with falsifying police reports in a years-long visa scheme in Louisiana.

item.title: Senate panel approves federal judge nomination for Emil Bove, who defended Trump
item.description: Bove's nomination to the 3rd Circuit Court of Appeals now moves to the full Senate. Scores of former DOJ lawyers and retired judges say they fear his loyalty to Trump would carry over onto the bench.

item.title: How China created a chokehold on the rare earths industry
item.description: China has been able to entirely cut off Europe and the U.S. from several critical rare earth metals. How did it develop such a stranglehold on an industry the U.S. once controlled?

item.title: The UK will lower its voting age to 16. Could the U.S. follow suit?
item.description: The British government aims to make all 16- and 17-year-olds eligible to vote starting in the next U.K. general election. Some voting age limits are changing in the U.S., but only at the local level.

item.title: How did Condé Nast go from dominance to decline? A new book explains

item.title: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The singer's life was touched by tragedies
item.description: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The first female singer to chart a number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100, she sold over 40 million records before the age of 25.
